intro: Appendicula verruculifera, commonly known as the疣果附生兰, is a small, epiphytic orchid native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It features delicate, slender stems that often grow along tree trunks or branches. The plant produces compact, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a loose cluster, typical of many orchid species. Its leaves are narrow and革质, adapted to retain moisture in humid environments. Appendicula verruculifera thrives in shaded, moist habitats and is often found in lowland forests.
